cc.altius.utils

Class DateUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • cc.altius.utils.DateUtils

  • public class DateUtils
extends Object
    This utility is used to get Dates in different time zone formats and convert from one format to another.
    Author:
    Akil Mahimwala

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentDateString

        public static String getCurrentDateString(String timeZone,
                                          String format)
        Returns the current date in a String format
        Parameters:
        timeZone - Select from the TimeZones available in DateUtils
        format - Select from the Formats available in DateUtils
        Returns:
        Returns Date value in format specified for the given time zone.

      • getCurrentDateObject

        public static Date getCurrentDateObject(String timeZone)
        Returns the current date object for the time zone specified
        Parameters:
        timeZone - Select from the TimeZones available in DateUtils
        Returns:
        Returns current Date object for the given time zone.

      • getOffsetFromCurrentDateString

        public static String getOffsetFromCurrentDateString(String timeZone,
                                                    String format,
                                                    int days)
        Returns the date as an offset from the current date in a String format.
        Parameters:
        timeZone - Select from the TimeZones available in DateUtils
        format - Select from the Formats available in DateUtils
        days - The number of days that you want as the offset. Can be positive or negative.
        Returns:
        Returns Date value in format specified for the given time zone.

      • getOffsetFromCurrentDateObject

        public static Date getOffsetFromCurrentDateObject(String timeZone,
                                                  int days)
        Returns the date as an offset from the current date as a Date object.
        Parameters:
        timeZone - Select from the TimeZones available in DateUtils
        days - The number of days that you want as the offset. Can be positive or negative.
        Returns:
        Returns Date object offset from the current date for the given time zone.

      • addDays

        public static Date addDays(Date dt,
                           int days)
        Adds days to the Date object given. days can be positive or negative.
        Parameters:
        dt - Date object that you want to add days to
        days - Number of days you want to add to the Date object. Cane be positive or negative.
        Returns:
        Returns the new Date object after adding the days to the Date object.

      • formatDate

        public static String formatDate(Date dt,
                                String format)
        Format a Date object into a standard format.
        Parameters:
        dt - Date object that you want to work on.
        format - Select the format that you want output in. Select from the formats available in DateUtils.
        Returns:
        Returns the Date in your specified format.

      • compareDate

        public static int compareDate(Date d1,
                              Date d2)
        Compares two Date objects to see which one is greater. The assumption is that both the Dates are from the same time zone returns -1 if d1 is less than d2, 1 if d1 is greater than d2, 0 if both are equal.
        Parameters:
        d1 - Date to be compared
        d2 - Date to be compared
        Returns:
        Returns -1 if d1 is less than d2, 1 if d1 is greater than d2, 0 if both are equal.

      • compareDates

        public static int compareDates(String d1,
                               String d2)
        Compares two Date that are in yyyy-MM-dd format to see which one is greater. The assumption is that both the Dates are from the same time zone returns -1 if d1 is less than d2, 1 if d1 is greater than d2, 0 if both are equal.
        Parameters:
        d1 - Date to be compared. Could be either yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss formats.
        d2 - Date to be compared. Could be either yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss formats.
        Returns:
        Returns -1 if d1 is less than d2, 1 if d1 is greater than d2, 0 if both are equal.

      • getDateFromString

        public static Date getDateFromString(String date,
                                     String format)
                              throws ParseException
        Parse the String and return the Date object
        Parameters:
        date - String that you want to parse
        format - Format that the date was passed in
        Returns:
        Returns the Date object after parsing
        Throws:
        ParseException - Throws ParseException if the date is not in the correct format indicated.
